column4: I just installed swiftfox using the AMD64 deb provided on its homepage, but when I try to run swiftfox what actually happens is that firefox is started. :-(
whats swiftfox ?
and did they have ubuntu dapper packages ?
I don't believe so.
well ...
well...?
if they dont have ubuntu dapper packages, youre only hope is to compile it yourself...
Why is that? What is wrong with the deb?
it has to be for ubuntu dapper !
Why? I'm fishing for the technical details here...
can you install windows xp programs on windows 3.1 ?
Is Ubuntu no longer based on Debian?
ubuntu dapper != ubuntu breezy != debian what ever
yeah its BASED on debian, but its NOT debian
linux is just the kernel
well, you just have to accept that ubuntu != debian, when it comes to install debian debs...
Apparently, if firefox is already open, swiftfox just opens another window of firefox... - on the flip side of that, the swiftfox deb works flawlessly
then things is, debian (may) have different versions of librarys on what a program depends.
thats the same case why you (mostly) cant even install dapper debs on breezy
and lets say a program depends on package foo12 on debian, but on ubuntu its called foo12-ubuntu1, how is that gonna work ?
and you have to update that package manually...
